string.text: Professor, I've heard you can make transmutation?

Yes, sometimes I do it, but you can imagine what it's worth, young man? Transmutation - a very rare and expensive toys! I could make them for you, of course, if you find the right components and some money. That's what I can offer you:
 "The sky." Increases muscle tone, increasing resistance to shock and lacerations. But it is quite fonit. 
 Manufacturing cost 35.000 Rub. Needed: Night Star, Moonlight, Battery. 

 "TJV". So named by our German colleagues, the first to manufacture it. Increases immunity to psychic stress.
 Manufacturing cost 55.000 Rub. Needed: Moonlight eyes of the flesh.

 "Goat horn". Due to its unique features, provides protection against bullets and shock waves.
 Manufacturing cost 100.000 Rub. Needed: Night Star, Mama's Beads, gravel and drops. 

 Hermes. Dual artifact. Making its bearer is incredibly hardy, eats it alive. 
 Manufacturing cost 35.000 Rub. Needed: Moonlight, cactus and mucus. 

 "Sponge." Protects against radiation and high temperatures. 
 Manufacturing cost 75.000 Rub. Needed: Mica, pacifiers, ball of fire. 

 "Honeycomb." Beneficial effect on the body affected by chemical poisoning. 
 Manufacturing cost 20.000 Rub. Needed: Film, crotchet. 

 "Red Star". Recovers HP and heals wounds. 
 Manufacturing cost 150.000 Rub. Needed: Soul, Mica, tissue samples bloodsucker. 

 "The Eye. "Not bad heals wounds. However, decreases resistance to PSI-effects. This artifact has a unique ability: if you put it on yourself, most Snork byurer you are not touched. 
 Manufacturing cost 85.000 Rub. Needed: Goldfish, Mica, a hand controller.
Professor, I hope you can order another transmutation.
Of course, young man. What interests you?
Make a Hermes, tired circles in the Zone with full kit to cut.
Make a "sponge", otherwise the night will soon begin to glow, or sopyus altogether.
Make a "Red Star", and it became like a mummy from these bandages
Oh, sorry for not enough money. I'll come later.
Take a young man, transmutation is ready!
Cool! I hope it's worth the money!
Or you can still do it?
Of course! At the moment I have free time.
